moves.1. e4: king's pawn opening. KPO. a very good opening move. white controls many light squares with this move.
moves.1... c5:
the best reply. sicilian defence.
controlling dark squares and expanding on the queen side.
moves.2... d6: black gets some space for his peices.
moves.3. d4: white creates ideal center. also opened several squares for his peices.
moves.3... cxd4:
black ends the W pawn formation.
...cxd is forced. other wise white might play d5 with good game.
moves.5... a6: a famous move. protecting b5 and planing to play b7-b5.
moves.6... e6:
vacating a sq for the B and protecting the N with Q so that after BxN blk can recapture with Q and keeping the pawns in good shape.
blk pawns on d6 & e6 are called small center.
moves.7. Nf3: third move of the N. i think white's advantage of first move is diminished. Qd2 is much better.
moves.8. e5:
white started attack.
should have focused on peice development.
moves.8... dxe5 9. Qxd8+ Bxd8 10. Nxe5 Nbd7: attacking the unprotected N with a developing move.
moves.12. O-O-O: R comes to open file with a trap.
moves.12... Bc6: ...0-0 ?? BxN removing the guard. BxB RxB.
moves.13. Bxf6: bad move, there was no need of taking this N and giving up well deployed piece.
moves.13... Bxf6:
blk has the advantage of 'pair'. both Bs are beautifully placed, pressurizing both wings.
blk has the upper hand.
moves.14. Ne2:
white saved himself from getting 3 isolated Ps.
if f3 then BxN PxB. WQ side will be weak.
moves.14... O-O:
protecting the K and connecting the Rs.
another method of joining the Rs was Ke7 but it has a flaw.
moves.16... Bg5+:
suddenly black attack and white resign.
note if the K was on e7 i can not play Bg5 due to check by the knight.
if Rd2 BxR Kb1 bxN
black has won a R.
if Kb1 RxR back rank mate.
